pullRequest.title: Search page Refine panel
pullRequest.bodyText:
#1306
Checklist

 the [contributor license agreement][] is signed
 commit message follows [commit guidelines][]
 tests are included
 screenshots are included showing significant UI changes
 documentation is changed or added

Description of change
Created a new component for the Refine search panel and integrated Search page with it. At the moment, some place holder refine controls are used.
Also slightly tweaked the structure of Search page so that the Refine panel is properly displayed.

commit.message:
Add a Refine panel for Search page

1. Add a new component RefineSearchPanel. It renders a MUI List and each
   child component is put inside a ListItem.
2. Refactor the outer Grid so that the main content takes 75% width and
   the Refine panel takes 25% width.
3. Due to the wrong Grid spacing, separate the nested Grid which is both
   an item and a container into two separate Grids

nodes.bodyText: Wowsers, this return has now become a bit incomprehensible. Let's refactor, and try and ensure it concisely captures the page layout and key elements.
I'm not sure we really need this. Does the panel have to be 100%. I'm kind of happy if it's just as big as its contents.

+ * agreements. See the NOTICE file distributed with this work for additional
+ * information regarding copyright ownership.

+ * Version 2.0, (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance

+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+import * as React from "react";
+import { ReactNode } from "react";
+import {
+  Card,
+  CardContent,
+  CardHeader,
+  List,
+  ListItem,
+  makeStyles,
+} from "@material-ui/core";
+import { languageStrings } from "../../util/langstrings";
+
+interface RefinePanelProps {
+  /**
+   * Child components rendered inside this panel.
+   */
+  children: ReactNode;
+}
+
+const useStyles = makeStyles({
+  refineSearchPanel: {
+    height: "100%", // Ensure Card always takes the item grid's full height.
+  },
+});

nodes.bodyText: We don't want the divider on the last one.

+  CardHeader,
+  List,
+  ListItem,
+  makeStyles,
+} from "@material-ui/core";
+import { languageStrings } from "../../util/langstrings";
+
+interface RefinePanelProps {
+  /**
+   * Child components rendered inside this panel.
+   */
+  children: ReactNode;
+}
+
+const useStyles = makeStyles({
+  refineSearchPanel: {
+    height: "100%", // Ensure Card always takes the item grid's full height.
+  },
+});
+
+export const RefineSearchPanel = ({ children }: RefinePanelProps) => {
+  const classes = useStyles();
+  const { title } = languageStrings.searchpage.refineSearchPanel;
+  return (
+    <Card className={classes.refineSearchPanel}>
+      <CardHeader title={title} />
+      <CardContent>
+        <List>
+          {React.Children.map(children, (child) => (
+            <ListItem divider>{child}</ListItem>

nodes.bodyText:
Is this worth fleshing out a little?
I'm aware its just a placeholder, but we are going to need to populate this panel with some sort of component made for it - eg. something along the lines of a new <SearchRefineControl/> component.
That said, if that's outside the scope of this PR that's fine too.

Yeah. If you can get an index out of that map, you should be able to go
divider={index != React.Children.count-1}

commit.message:
Restructure Search page and a few Search controls

1. The TextField of SearchBar is now wrapped in a Card.
2. Move pagination from Search page to its own component.
3. Move Search result list to its own component and put the spinner,
   sort order select and pagination in this component.
4. Replace MUI ExpansionPanel with MUI Accordion for component SearchResult.
Remove the Divider added on the last Search refine control.
Remove the style applied on RefineSearchPanel.
